TER.TERdecoder.SegmentDecoder
Class DecodeGeneration

java.lang.Object
  TER.TERdecoder.SegmentDecoder.DecodeGeneration

public class DecodeGeneration
extends java.lang.Object

This class decodes as many generations of AC components of a block as user requires for a given bitplane. Usage example:
  construct
  setParameters
  run
  get functions

Version:
1.05
Author:
Group on Interactive Coding of Images (GICI)

Field Detail

encodedSegment

EntropyDecoderAC encodedSegment
This object is used to entropy decode the words that are needed in decoding process.

parametersSet

boolean parametersSet
To know if parameters are set.

True indicates that they are set otherwise false.

block

int[][][][] block
This array contains AC components of the recovered block. Usage : block[resolutionLevel][family][x][y]

run

public void run(int bitPlane,
                int initResolutionLevel,
                int endResolutionLevel,
                byte[][] significantPiramid,
                byte Ds,
                byte[] D)
         throws java.lang.Exception
Decodes as many generation as the user requires

Parameters:
bitPlane - indicates the bit plane that must be decoded
initResolutionLevel - indicates the resolution level where decoding process begins
endResolutionLevel - indicates the last resolution level to be decoded
significantPiramid - definition in CodeBlockAC.significantPiramid
Ds - definition in CodeBlockAC.Ds
D - definition in CodeBlockAC.D
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - when there appears some problems and the decoding of the block must be stopped

setPreviousSignificance

private void setPreviousSignificance(int bitPlane)
Given a bitplane updates the significance piramid. Note that this only must be done once for each bit plane

Parameters:
bitPlane - indicates the bit plane that must be decoded

getRecoveryValue

private int getRecoveryValue(int bitPlane,
                             int rLevel,
                             int subband)
Gets the recovered value for each bit plane.

Parameters:
bitPlane - indicates the bitplane that is being decoded
rLevel - indicates the resolution level of the subband to be encoded
subband - determines the subband once is known the resolution level
Returns:
an integer that represents the recovered value
